meanings.definition: The mental faculty of purpose, desire, or will to perform an action.
meanings.sent1: Her conations drove her to excel in her studies.
meanings.sent2: His conations to help others made him a beloved member of the community.
meanings.sent3: The conations of the cat to catch the laser pointer entertained the whole family.
meanings.sent4: The conations of the seed to grow into a mighty tree were unstoppable.
meanings.sent5: The conations of the athlete to win the race were evident in every step.

meanings.definition: The act of striving or attempting to achieve a goal.
meanings.sent1: Their conations led them to start their own business.
meanings.sent2: The conations of the team to win the championship were strong.
meanings.sent3: The conations of the squirrel to reach the bird feeder were comical to watch.
meanings.sent4: The conations of the river to reach the ocean symbolized its determination.
meanings.sent5: The conations of the student to ace the exam were admirable.

meanings.definition: The conscious or unconscious urge to act or behave in a certain way.
meanings.sent1: His conations to explore new places led him on exciting adventures.
meanings.sent2: The conations of the baby to grab everything within reach kept the parents on their toes.
meanings.sent3: The conations of the dog to chase its tail never failed to bring a smile.
meanings.sent4: The conations of the storm to unleash its power were felt by all.
meanings.sent5: The conations of the artist to create beautiful paintings were evident in every brushstroke.
